website_summaries.verdict: The Optoma HD161X home theater projector delivers impressive image quality with excellent color and sharp detail, plus some features that aren't typically available at this price.
pros: Two HDMI connectors, plus component video using three RCA connectors
cons: Shows rainbow artifacts, primarily in black-and-white film clips

customer_reviews.title: GREAT CHOICE
customer_reviews.text: this is my first projector. I am NOT tech savvy. the set up was simple and according to my son, who has had a BenQ projector at his house for over a year, my HD161X is far superior. There is smooth action with no image jump. The only thing I did not like was the fact there is no speaker or audio function for the projector. I bought a sony surround sound Blu-ray. The picture is fantastic. I coupled it with a 128" Elite screen. I also like the 2d to 3d function which converts any 2d program into 3d. The live sports programming did not up-convert well, but recorded programs and dvd/blu-ray are great.
customer_reviews.author: A and J Pence

customer_reviews.title: I got this projector for a good price and it's great for my bedroom
customer_reviews.text: I got this projector for a good price and it's great for my bedroom. Only downside is that for some reason, its trigger works for a second when I turn the projector on, then turns off for a few seconds and only then comes back on. this makes the screen start to go down when I turn on the projector, then go up again and only afte rabout 5-10 seconds go back again for good.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Eizik

customer_reviews.title: I'm very pleased with this purchase
customer_reviews.text: I'm very pleased with this purchase. We set the projector up outside with a 16 foot screen and the image was crisp and sharp. I spent several hours researching all brands and models looking for he best projector regardless of price. I couldn't be happier with the quality of the image and the price I paid. I don't know what the life expectancy of the bulb or replacement cost is but up to this point we give it 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: DAVID DARRAGH

customer_reviews.title: 3D problem in this great product
customer_reviews.text: Video is very crisp and clear but there is a very big problem regarding 3d, it worked sometimes and other not, and now for more that a month it never worked and I tried all options Please if any one help me in 3 d issue for this great product Akram
customer_reviews.author: Akram freijeh

customer_reviews.title: main board failure "not talked about"
customer_reviews.text: I've had this projector for a little over 2 years and one day out of the blue I get the very common supposedly "main board failure ".black screen !menu won't even come up. picuture was great then poof.i would think a main board should outlast the first bulb
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Projector, once you figure out the sound
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic Projector. I have it shot up on my living wall to about 270 inches, and picture is absolutely beautiful, even during the day (though admittedly better at night). Note that there is no audio outputs on this projector, so you will need to link HDMI through a sound bar prior to connecting the projector, or other means for sound. Got this on prime day for $680, and it is one of the best purchases I have ever made
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic Picture completely fills the screen. Mounted on ceiling 11.5 feet from the screen. Paired with the STR-169106 Silver Ticket 4K Ultra HD Ready Cinema Format (6 Piece Fixed Frame) Projector Screen (16:9, 106", White Material)
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: #1 for all but no speaker
customer_reviews.text: Returned do no speaker? It appeared to be absolutely the best for everything else but if you want a speaker then this isn't for you.
customer_reviews.author: Mary A. Jarrett

customer_reviews.title: HD161X
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to compliment my Optoma HD33. The HD161X produces a very nice image. The picture is clean a crisp and is a little brighter than my HD33. Motion is very smooth and it has several functions to make fine picture adjustments. I sit ~ 6 ft from the projector and I cannot hear it running while in Eco. mode. I would love to keep this unit; however, it is a little too expensive here in Canada. I see no reason as to why this projector is ~$150 more expensive in Canada and I am not willing to pay the extra money, so I will be returning the unit - too bad...it's a lovely projector.
customer_reviews.author: Brent Baker

customer_reviews.title: I HATE IT, BETTER OPTIONS FOR LESS MONEY
customer_reviews.text: INCREDIBLE " NOT SPEAKERS " NOT SOUND, NOT AUDIO OUT, I HATE IT, BETTER OPTIONS FOR LESS MONEY. I AM VERY SAD WITH MY OPTOMA 161X.
customer_reviews.author: Sergio Gonzalez De Alba

product_meta.title: Optoma HD161X 1080p 3D DLP Home Theater Projector
product_meta.description: Style:Projector OnlyThe Optoma HD161X Home Cinema projector delivers up to 300" diagonal, stunning quality high definition 1080p video with perfectly balanced color, sharp, crystal clear image with crisp details and judder-free motion thanks to Optima's exclusive PureEngine technology. With a 2000 lumens bright image and fifth-generation Dynamic Black technology to generate a remarkable 40,000:1 contrast ratio, the Optoma HD161X produces visually stunning video that is richer, more saturated, with higher color accuracy and better tonal range for natural looking skin tones and true-to-life colors. The HD161X redefines the home cinema category with its extensive list of advanced features: all glass, multi-coated lens with vertical lens shift and 1.5X zoom ratio provides superior focus and installation flexibility, Ultra Detail II for visibly sharper image detail, Pure Color for vivid and balanced color, PureMotion for judder-free video, Real 2D to 3D Technology converts standard video to 3D, powered USB port and much more.
feature_bullets: Screen Size Range: 65-inches from 8 feet; 99-inches from 12 feet
2000 ANSI Lumens; Keystone Correction: Yes, Lens Shift: Yes;
1-Year Limited Parts and Labor, 90-Days on Lamp
Two HDMI v1.4a, VGA-in, 3D VESA, component, composite video, 12V trigger, USB-A (for power), RS-232C, USB mini-B

specifications.Special Features: Single 0.65" DC3 DMD DLP Technology by Texas Instruments, Native Full HD 1080p Resolution
specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.5 out of 5 stars27 ratings3.5 out of 5 stars
